New Records: The Dodgers’ NL record for one postseason reached 33 consecutive scoreless innings, tying the postseason record of the 1966 Orioles.
Key Match Events: The Mets were defeated 9-0 by the Dodgers in Game 1 of the National League Championship Series.
Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty pitched seven scoreless innings.
Mets starter Kodai Senga struggled, throwing 30 pitches with 20 balls and allowing three straight walks in the first inning.
Max Muncy lined Senga’s 21st pitch into center field, scoring the first two runs.
Shohei Ohtani singled home Gavin Lux in the second inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Mets fans serenaded owner Steve Cohen before the game with chants of 'Uncle Steve'.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza commented on Senga's performance, stating 'He was off. He didn’t have it.'
Jose Iglesias expressed optimism, saying 'We are going to come back tomorrow with the best energy and continue to compete.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers had just completed a hard-fought series with the Padres before facing the Mets.
